creditline: Gift of Roberta and Richard Simmons
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Three-panel huipil; square neck with applied fabric ruffle that is tacked down to ground cloth with appliquéd rickrack; supplementary weft and weft-faced patterning, red and white striped ground with fine stripes of other colors within red stripes; weft-face patterns are primarily rows of zigzags in pink, purple, green and orange, alternating with plain red stripes; contemporary style.
medium: Cotton; discontinuous supplementary weft patterning, appliqué
title: Woman's blouse (Huipil)
